‚úî An application to construct a five-storey, 10,000 square metres government hub in Brunswick Street has been approved by the town planning committee. üè¢ The new offices on Brunswick Street will build on the success of the Darlington Economic Campus (DEC), currently comprising Feethams House and Bishopsgate House, in the town centre. üí∑ The development will house nine government departments and will bring more high-quality jobs to the town including nearly 500 new civil service positions, while supporting continued inward investment to Darlington. üî® Work on site is set to begin later this year with completion earmarked for 2027. ‚Ñπ For more information visit https://lnkd.in/evhADpJW

A revised planning proposal to improve outdoor hospitality facilities to support the developing pavement caf√© culture on Coniscliffe Road has been approved. Plans include: ‚úÖ widening existing pavements ‚úÖ a new pocket park with seating ‚úÖ the installation of trees and planters ‚úÖ the installation of new bollards and signage ‚úÖ realignment of the carriage way ‚úÖ the introduction of a cycle park. The project forms part of wider plans to regenerate the town centre and will clean and green the area, creating a safe and attractive environment where people can dwell and explore the wide range of independent businesses in the immediate area. Work is set to begin in October with a view to this being completed in Spring 2025. Businesses will remain open as usual with access maintained during the works.

Learning & Skills in Darlington offers free courses to help people whose first language is not English to develop their communication skills for everyday situations, including the work environment. Courses focus on building the basics of the English language and support learners to read, write and speak clearly in English. Sayeda, a learner currently enrolled with Learning & Skills said, "To be able to communicate with people is very useful. I now have the chance to help my children in school, with the GP and to get a job". You can hear more about Sayeda's experience and English courses for speakers of other languages on YouTube - @DarlingtonBC Enrolment is now open www.darlington.gov.uk/ESOL

Learning & Skills in Darlington offer a range of FREE activity-based courses to support people to develop new interests or skills for daily living. An older learner who has been attending a creative crafts course said it had been tremendous and has got her going out again - ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs a lovely teacher and she‚Äôs really easy to talk to ‚Äì I‚Äôve enjoyed it.‚Äù Find out more about the experience of learners on the course on YouTube @DarlingtonBC Enrolment for 2024/25 is now open ‚Äì for more information visit https://lnkd.in/ePr95pk2

üì£ We‚Äôre Hiring ‚Äì Environmental Health Officer If you are a highly motivated with a relevant qualification (a degree in Environmental Health/Higher Certificate in Food Control or equivalent) we can offer you an attractive working environment within the Commercial Environmental Health Team. You will be working as part of a team responsible for the enforcement of Food Safety, Health & Safety, Infection Control, Commercial Noise and responding to planning consultations. Visit: www.darlington.gov.uk/jobs to learn more about the benefits of working with us and start your application.

üèñ We do love to be beside the seaside! Thanks to our sponsors Arriva UK Bus, residents of all ages had a fantastic time at this year's Darlington by the Sea. With the help of bucket loads of sand from JT Atkinson & Sons Ltd. we turned the Market Square into a beach with free fun and entertainment for families! This is one of our most popular events and attracts residents from across the town. We love being able to bring a bit of the seaside to those who, for many reasons, can't travel to the coast. Thankfully the sun shone and we are now working to redistribute the sand to our playgrounds so the fun can continue!

Apprenticeships are a brilliant option for people of all ages to launch their careers and give people the opportunity to do a real job and earn money while studying for a formal qualification. Learning & Skills Darlington offer a wide range of apprenticeships, including seven within the health and social care sector. Chelsea, a care worker at Moorlands in Darlington has achieved her Level 2 and 3 apprenticeship in adult care with Learning & Skills and is now giving back to new apprentices; sharing her knowledge and experience to help them develop and get the job they want. Chelsea says, ‚ÄúI would encourage anyone to do an apprenticeship with Learning & Skills because you get the support you need, and you can move onto the next phase of your life and progress in your career.‚Äù https://lnkd.in/dsrZtXEK Enrolment for 2024/25 is now open - visit https://lnkd.in/ePr95pk2

Cycle to Work Day ‚Äì Thursday 1 August Are you and your employees ready to cycle to work. Cycling on a regular basis has proven health benefits both physical and mental. #CycletoWorkDay aims to encourage as many people as possible to get on their bike and pedal to work. There are prizes to be won as well as the benefits to the planet and your purse. More details are at: https://lnkd.in/eARZYJVS. If you want more details on travel planning for your employees simply contact our travel advisors. They can offer help and advice on travel planning including bus, train, walking and cycling. Simply email the team: traveladvisors@darlington.gov.uk or call 07966 883805. Check out our website travel section at: https://lnkd.in/eQ8HiNxW

‚òÄÔ∏èDarlington by the Sea returns! Thanks to our sponsors Arriva UK Bus, residents can slap on the sun cream and dig out their bucket and spade as the beach comes to town next week! Join us for five days of sun (hopefully), sand and fun from Wednesday 24 July to Sunday 28 July. Each day from 11am until 5pm, families can enjoy free sandcastle building, activities, entertainment and fun and games. Thanks also to JT Atkinson & Sons Ltd. for helping with the play sand which will be redistributed to our playgrounds after the event.

Learning & Skills in Darlington offers FREE functional skills courses for adult learners who have not achieved GCSEs in English, maths or ICT; helping them to get the qualifications they need to secure the job they want. A new film highlights the personal experiences of the real people enrolled on courses, including Tracy, a 37 year-old, single parent with two children who has recently landed her dream job working with children with special needs. Take a look at https://lnkd.in/d-_4jAhQ Enrolment for 2024/25 is now open - find out more at https://lnkd.in/ePr95pk2
